column4: so I reloaded one of my computers from CentOS to ubuntu, everything went fine, but I have a couple of extra HD in there and can't get them to mount
and... you couldnt mount them manually?
edit the fstab to mount them correctly ? or are you talking about a deeper prob lem?
: well first I just wanted to mount them using the mount command and check what is on the drive then I would edit fstab to make the mount perm
: no, it says unrecognized file sys
now we are getting to the 'actual' problem....
they may bee reiserfs, or somthing else..  could fire up gparted and see what it says they are.. or use 'sudo fdisk -l'
if you are using LVM - then i got no clue. i dont bother with LVM at all.
gparted shows filesystem unknown for all my drives
so they are all for lvm?
you are on ya own then. :) ive never used lvm at all.. never saw the need for it.
you need an identd server for some reason? those things are normally not needed any more.
dare we ask why. :) thers dozens of the services you can install , also thers a identd written in perl (like 4 lines of code) that ive used in the past.
all of them should work. :) otherwise.. whats the point of them
